page.title: 16Transport; Upton Snodsbury
page.content: Public transport is scarce in this very rural area. A Midland Red bus passes through the villages once in each direction on Wednesdays en route from Worcester to Redditch. On Saturdays a bus from Inkberrow to Worcester and back also passes through. School buses take the older children to Worcester or Pershore in the term time and will take other paying passengers when possible. Otherwise residents are dependent on private cars - the majority of households possess at least one, but those without can be very housebound, particularly the elderly and infirm. Neighbours are often helpful in giving lifts.
